  • Lead customer communication on Smartly optimization features, and A/B and incrementality testing, and sophisticated research results to a general audience
  • Drive customer adoption of best standards, measurement methodologies, and products


What We Are Looking For...

  • 5+ years experience in marketing measurement, analytics, growth marketing, or a related field
  • Experience working with structured and unstructured data-sets in Python and SQL
  • Master's Degree in Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field or similar knowledge
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills as well as familiarity with large data sets and data manipulation tools
  • Ability and willingness to become an expert in digital performance marketing
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment, collaborating with technical and non-technical collaborators in a customer-facing role
  • Ability to work from our Berlin or Helsinki office at least 2 days a week (hybrid)


Meet Smartly

Smartly is the AI-powered advertising technology company transforming ad experiences for brands and their consumers. Our comprehensive advertising platform seamlessly integrates the capabilities of media, creative, and intelligence to power more than 800 billion impressions and generate more than 300 billion creatives annually, delivering tangible business outcomes for brands and advertisers. We are the only company managing creative and media for 700+ brands worldwide and $5B in ad spend across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Google, Instagram, Pinterest, Snap, and TikTok. Our end-to-end technology, unmatched access to media platforms and exceptional customer service help Fortune 500 brands to reach and engage consumers and learn what performs best.

Smartly is a multinational and diverse team of 650+ Smartlies from 60+ nationalities, working in 13 countries. Together, we want to create and maintain an inclusive environment where everyone feels respected and heard. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion approach is at the heart of it.

Visit Smartly.io to learn more.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Picsart is looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst. The Senior Data Analyst role will lead strategic business decisions by developing and providing data analysis and reporting of complex patterns, insights and trends to internal stakeholders. These insights will help solve highly complex business problems, implement best practices and optimise business performance.

By joining us, you will benefit from


An honest, open culture that emphasises feedback and promotes professional and personal development.
Hybrid setup— our team is distributed worldwide, from Armenia to US, UK, Germany, Spain and Romania
Wellbeing benefits (including a monthly wellbeing fund)
Growing opportunities — based on your preference you can grow in the company as a people manager or as an individual contributor.
An environment that fosters innovation and creativity, a culture with the ability to pilot new trends


You will


Work with huge datasets - get, clean and analyze them, use advanced and predictive analytics to create reports and intuitive dashboards
Partner with Business and IT teams to understand data/reporting needs, offer solutions to address specific data/reporting challenges
Execute on business/technical requirements and build multi-purpose interactive dashboard solutions, based on gathered requirements
Visualize and make effective presentations to communicate complex findings in a structured way for non-technical audience
Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests and other experiments to optimize user conversion and retention
Dig deeper into data and find reasons for trends, and metrics changes
Integrate new tools to solve problems more effectively when needed
Define the underlying architecture of data collection and ensure data consistency and accuracy during the transformation process.


About You


BS/MA degree in Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or a related field
3-5 years experience in an analytics or data science position working with large data sets from enterprise database platforms, business intelligence development tools to solve complex business problems
Excellent knowledge of data manipulation languages such as SQL, Python (Pandas, visualization and statistical libraries, etc.)
Strong experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions and explains the whys, utilizing tools like Tableau, Looker, or similar
Solid understanding of statistical concepts, hypothesis testing, and regression analysis.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to manage data collection process, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail
Strong synthesis skills with the ability to analyze huge amount of data and extract insights that will drive the product
Excellent communication and knowledge sharing skills to convey technical findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated, quick learner and innovative person
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently.
Detail-oriented and able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Advanced written and verbal English communication skills.


What we seek and value most in our candidates

Professionalism in both soft and hard skills; motivation to grow, learn and share, positive attitude, flexibility, transparency, ownership and the most important - passion and commitment.

Picsart is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

Picsart, Inc. is an E-Verify Employer in the US. Please click here for the E-Verify Poster in English or Spanish. For information regarding your Right To Work, please click here for English or Spanish.

For Applicants Based in California - California Job Applicant Privacy Notice (https://rb.gy/lqu5mv)

About Us

Picsart is the world’s largest digital creation platform and a top 20 most downloaded app. Every month, the Picsart community creates, remixes, and shares billions of visual stories using the company’s powerful and easy-to-use editing tools. Picsart has amassed one of the largest open-source content collections in the world, including free-to-edit photos, stickers, backgrounds, templates, and more. Picsart is available in 30 languages for free and as a subscription on iOS, Android, Windows devices and on the Web. Headquartered in Miami, with offices around the world, Picsart is backed by SoftBank, Sequoia Capital, DCM Ventures, Insight Partners, and others. Download the app or visit picsart.com for more information.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Berlin, Hybrid)
Description:
We're currently in a growth phase after Series B funding and are looking for people who can join us as soon as possible.

A Little About Us


Kittl isn’t just another design platform: We’re here to transform the way creators work, offering an intuitive platform as a competitive alternative to clunky and outdated traditional design tools
Boasting millions of users only 2 years after launch
Diverse team: 100+ team members from 25+ different countries
Product-led: Product managers, engineers, and designers are at the heart of Kittl
Funding: Kittl has raised more than $50M from some of the most prestigious investors in the world that also have backed companies like Slack, Dropbox and Figma.


We have a hybrid working culture with 3 days per week as office days in our Berlin headquarters. We're growing London as our second location, with an office in London coming by the end of 2024.

Learn more: www.kittl.com/career

Your role at Kittl

Our data function is a small, dedicated team but now ready to grow and evolve; so you’ll be making a huge impact. Kittl is scaling fast, and the need for data-driven insights and product development is becoming increasingly important.

As a Senior Data Scientist you’ll be instrumental in supporting the product teams with making the right decisions to continue Kittl’s growth. You will be forecasting and predicting the value that our tools deliver to our users. You will also lead the data team in developing practical machine learning applications in order to enable innovative and customer-facing product features. In doing so, you will have a proven impact on bringing Kittl’s mission to life.

While experience is valuable, we prioritise drive, intelligence, and integrity. If you embody these qualities, we encourage you to apply, even if you don’t meet every requirement.

What You'll Do


Data Analysis & Modeling: Use statistical methods to analyse data and generate useful business insights for our product teams.
Ideation & KPI setting: Forming ideas and acting as a key strategic partner to product teams as we define roadmaps. You’ll be the person closest to the data and have a unique perspective on how users are interacting with different aspects of our product. With this knowledge, you will work closely with product managers and leadership to define the development roadmap for different areas of the Kittl platform.
Ownership: Owning projects, data models, dashboards, and other artefacts and keeping them up-to-date and of high quality in a hyper growth environment
A/B Testing: Design, execute, and analyse A/B tests and other experiments to optimise user conversion and retention.
Model Development: as we scale, the need for advanced ML models is growing. We already have multiple projects in the pipeline, and you will lead the development of these.
Data Culture: Maintain a culture of rigour and data-informed decision making to drive tangible business impact


What You’ll Need


Experience: 4+ years of experience developing and productionising Machine Learning models within fast-moving SaaS companies
A/B testing: Experience setting up A/B tests, interpreting results, and measuring the business impact
Cloud: Practical experience training models in a Cloud Environment (eg: AWS Sagemaker, Azure ML Studio, or GCP)
Big data processing: Hands-on experience with big data processing / distributed data pipelines and tools such as Apache Airflow and Spark
Python: Proficiency in programming in Python, software design, version control and code reviews
Soft skills: Good communication skills and comfortable explaining complex ideas, with the ability to work in a collaborative environment where priorities and requirements may change in a short notice
LLMs: Experience with training or fine-tuning AI models (LLMs) is a plus


Interview process


Recruiter interview (30 minutes)
Hiring manager interview (45 minutes)
Take home case study (5 days)
Case study presentation with Senior Data Scientist and Senior Product Manager (45 minutes)
Bar raiser interview with Founders Associate, right hand to CEO (30 minutes)


Benefits


Urban Sports Club membership discount
Mobility benefit: monthly public transport (BVG) ticket fully covered by the company
German language courses subsidised by the company
30 vacation days per year for all employees
An allowance of 50 working days per year (10 weeks, if you count the weekend) of fully remote work from anywhere in the world, as long as you maintain common working hours (12pm to 5pm CET)
We have a hybrid setup with an office in Berlin, and work-from-home days so that we can foster a nice culture and in-person collaboration when needed
Common working hours are 12pm to 5pm CET, with the rest of your working time being flexible so you can work in a style that suits you best (early riser or a night owl)
You'll be working with a truly product-led company with PM's, engineers and designers at the heart of the company
Regular team events and offsites


🌈 At Kittl, we embrace diversity and value every team member's unique background, identity, and experience. We're all about respect, honesty, and inclusivity. Together, we create a safe and supportive work environment where everyone thrives. Join us on this exciting journey of making our company and product even better!

🌈 At Kittl, we embrace diversity and value every team member's unique background, identity, and experience. We're all about respect, honesty, and inclusivity. Together, we create a safe and supportive work environment where everyone thrives. Join us on this exciting journey of making our company and product even better!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist für die Energiewende (m/w/d)*
Description:
Warum zu uns

Weil der „Wir-Gedanke“ bei uns gelebt wird.

Seit Dezember 2022 ist con|energy consult gmbh Teil der Tagueri AG. Unter dem gemeinsamen Dach werden professionelle Lösungen für die Energiethemen der Gegenwart und Zukunft angeboten und (kommunale) Unternehmenskunden aller Branchen mit vollumfänglicher Beratung und Umsetzung zur Gestaltung der Energie-, Wärme und Mobilitätswende begleitet.

Für unseren Energiespezialisten con|energy consult gmbh wird ein Junior Consultant mit Schwerpunkt Wärmemarkt, Quartiere, EDL (m/w/d) * gesucht.

Was wir gemeinsam vorhaben


Kundenspezifische Aufgabenstellungen im Zuge der kommunalen Wärmeplanung und integrierten Infrastrukturplanung analysieren und modellieren
Bei der Konzeptionierung und Programmierung unserer cloudbasierten Softwarelösung simergy unterstützen
Modellentwicklungen unseres Simulationsmodells (teil-) verantworten
Große Datenmengen zur Beantwortung aktueller Fragestellungen analysieren, verarbeiten sowie visualisieren
ETL-Prozesse erarbeiten und weiterentwickeln
Ergebnisse dokumentieren und aufbereiten
Mit dem Projektteam, Stakeholder:innen und Kund:innen direkt kommunizieren (intern als auch extern) und eng zusammenarbeiten


Womit Sie überzeugen


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Energiewirtschaft oder Energietechnik
Analytische und konzeptionelle Denkweise sowie hohe Affinität zu Zahlen und Algorithmen
Erfahrungen und Freude und an der Modellierung von komplexen technisch-wirtschaftlichen Zusammenhängen
Erfahrungen mit einer Programmiersprache z.B. Python
Erste Erfahrungen mit relationalen Datenbanken (z.B. SQL) sowie Cloud-Computing (z.B. AWS, Docker)
Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Geodaten und Tools wie z.B. QGIS von Vorteil
Erfahrung im Umgang mit gängigen Office-Lösungen
Berufserfahrung im energiewirtschaftlichen Umfeld von Vorteil
Ausgeprägter Teamgeist und Verantwortungsbewusstsein
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift


Worauf Sie sich freuen

Unsere Besondere Unternehmenskultur


Arbeiten in einem renommierten, stark wachsenden Beratungs- und Dienstleistungshaus, das sich zusammen mit der Tagueri mit einem eigenen Nachhaltigkeitsprogramm für die Energiewende engagiert
Zahlreiche Team- und Unternehmensevents wie unser jährliches Sommerfest zusammen mit unseren Familien


Unsere Benefits für Wohlergehen und Wachstum:


Smartes Arbeiten, z.B. mobiles Arbeiten an bis zu zwei Tagen pro Woche
Zusatzleistungen, z.B. Corporate Benefits, JobRad, Job-Ticket sowie Öko-Zuschuss
Möglichkeit zur privaten Nutzung von Smartphone, Laptop und BahnCard


Unser gemeinsamer Weg:


Anspruch und Abwechslung in den Projekten bei namhaften Kunden der Energiewirtschaft und ihren Partnern
Intensive Einarbeitung durch ein strukturiertes Onboarding
Regelmäßige Feedback- und Mitarbeitendengespräche zur schnellen persönlichen Weiterentwicklung


Was Sie wissen sollten

Wir suchen Persönlichkeiten! Daher prüfen wir Ihre Bewerbung nicht ausschließlich auf eine bestimmte Stelle bezogen, sondern als eine Bewerbung an das Unternehmen Tagueri. In einem persönlichen Gespräch finden wir gemeinsam heraus, ob Ihre Ziele und unsere Vorstellungen zueinander passen.

Sie finden sich nicht im Themengebiet und Standort wieder? Lassen Sie uns gerne Ihre Initiativbewerbung zukommen. Vergleichbare Themen haben wir auch an anderen Standorten!

Alles Weitere erzählen wir Ihnen in einem persönlichen Gespräch. Senden Sie Ihre Unterlagen entweder per Mail an bewerbung@tagueri.com oder nutzen Sie den "Jetzt Bewerben"-Button (Dateigröße max. 35 MB).

Über uns

con|energy consult ist Teil der Tagueri AG, einer wachsenden Unternehmensberatung mit über 750 Mitarbeitenden deutschlandweit.

Wir bei con|energy consult beraten Unternehmen der Energiewirtschaft, ihre Partner:innen und Kommunen, wenn es um strategische, wirtschaftliche, politische und organisatorische Fragen zur Energieversorgung und ihrer Transformation geht. Wir sind leidenschaftliche Expert:innen in den Themen der Energie-, Wärme- und Mobilitätswende – vom ersten Kund:innengespräch bis zum erfolgreichen Abschluss. Dabei sind wir uns unserer gesellschaftlichen Verantwortung bewusst und unterstützen unsere Kund:innen in der sich stetig verändernden Energiewelt.

Wir sind uns unserer gesellschaftlichen Verantwortung bewusst und daher fördern und leben wir eine tolerante, feedbackgebende und nachhaltige Unternehmenskultur.


Geschlecht, Hautfarbe, Alter, Herkunft, Hobbys, Religion, sexuelle Orientierung, Geschlechtsidentität? Für uns nicht relevant! Diskriminierung lehnen wir ab! Um unser Engagement für ein diverses Miteinander zu unterstreichen, haben wir in 2022 die Charta der Vielfalt unterschrieben.
Show more

con|energy consult ist Teil der Tagueri AG, einer wachsenden Unternehmensberatung mit über 750 Mitarbeitenden deutschlandweit.

Wir bei con|energy consult beraten Unternehmen der Energiewirtschaft, ihre Partner:innen und Kommunen, wenn es um strategische, wirtschaftliche, politische und organisatorische Fragen zur Energieversorgung und ihrer Transformation geht. Wir sind leidenschaftliche Expert:innen in den Themen der Energie-, Wärme- und Mobilitätswende – vom ersten Kund:innengespräch bis zum erfolgreichen Abschluss. Dabei sind wir uns unserer gesellschaftlichen Verantwortung bewusst und unterstützen unsere Kund:innen in der sich stetig verändernden Energiewelt.

Wir sind uns unserer gesellschaftlichen Verantwortung bewusst und daher fördern und leben wir eine tolerante, feedbackgebende und nachhaltige Unternehmenskultur.

  • Geschlecht, Hautfarbe, Alter, Herkunft, Hobbys, Religion, sexuelle Orientierung, Geschlechtsidentität? Für uns nicht relevant! Diskriminierung lehnen wir ab! Um unser Engagement für ein diverses Miteinander zu unterstreichen, haben wir in 2022 die Charta der Vielfalt unterschrieben.

Title: Senior IoT Data Scientist
Description:
Our client is a dynamic Green Tech IoT company based in the heart of Berlin, seeking a talented and passionate Senior/Lead Data Scientist to join their team. They are developing innovative solutions to address pressing environmental challenges through the power of Wildfire Detection.




As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in unlocking the potential of our data, driving product innovation, and shaping our company's growth.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement robust data pipelines to efficiently process and transform large volumes of sensor data.
Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and insights that inform product development and business strategy.
Build predictive models to optimise system performance, enhance user experience, and drive operational efficiency.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, product managers, and domain experts, to translate data insights into actionable recommendations.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning to drive innovation.




Qualifications:

Master’s or PhD degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data science or a related field.
Proficient in Python.
Strong experience with machine learning frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn.
Strong experience with modelling tabular data: Time Series Forecasting, Decision Trees, XGBoost, Ensemble techniques.
Strong experience with advanced data analysis techniques: PCA, T-SNE, k-means clustering.
Experience with end-to-end ML pipeline tooling: ETL pipelines, MLflow.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.




What they offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package plus stock
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects with a high impact
Collaborative and inspiring work environment
Flexible work arrangements
Continuous learning and development opportunities




If you are a data scientist with a passion for sustainability and a proven track record of success, we encourage you to apply! Join us in building a greener future.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (d/f/m)
Description:
At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.

Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.

Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.

Join eBay's innovative team that stands at the intersection of cutting-edge machine learning technology and e-commerce. Our team is dedicated to creating a diverse and inclusive culture where creativity and collaboration drive the development of intelligent systems that enhance the global online marketplace. As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will have a significant role in designing and developing machine learning systems, which involves assessing and organizing data, driving tests and experiments, and generally monitoring and optimizing machine learning processes to help develop strong performing machine learning systems. You will collaborate closely with multi-functional teams including managers, developers, business analysts and data scientists to deliver products and services that leverage machine learning techniques.

What You Will Accomplish


Designing, developing, and researching Machine Learning systems, models
Studying, transforming, and converting data science prototypes
Searching and selecting appropriate data sets before performing data collection and data modeling
Performing statistical analysis and using results to improve models
Training and retraining machine learning systems and models as needed, monitor quality of the models in production
Identifying differences in data distribution that could affect model performance in real-world situations
Visualizing data for deeper insights
Analyzing the use cases of machine learning algorithms and ranking them by their success probability
Enriching existing machine learning frameworks and libraries
Verifying data quality and/or ensuring it via data cleaning



What You Will Bring


Proven experience in building machine learning models in computer vision or natural language processing related fields
Experience in modern ML tooling related to experiment management, containerization, orchestration, processing pipelines and data version control
Experience in bringing ML models in production, monitoring and maintaining them throughout their entire life cycle. Familiarity with DevOps and MLOps cultures
Proficient in Python for scripting and data manipulation tasks and software development best practices
Proficient in SQL for querying and managing databases
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Fluent spoken and written English



What Sets You Apart


Proven track record in leading multi-functional teams and collaborating effectively with partners at different levels of the organization
Experience with PyTorch, Google Cloud, Kubeflow, AirFlow, ElasticSearch
A coaching & knowledge sharing mindset
Experience in working with crowdsourcing approaches for collecting datasets
Experience in mentoring junior positions and collaboration with data analytics or data engineers on the projects
Experience in working remotely



Please see the Talent Privacy Notice for information regarding how eBay handles your personal data collected when you use the eBay Careers website or apply for a job with eBay.

eBay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for accommodation as soon as possible. View our accessibility statement to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities.

Jobs posted with location as "Remote - United States (Excludes: HI, NM)" excludes residents of Hawaii and New Mexico.

Title: Python Engineer - Django/Fastapi (m/f/d)
Description:
What We Do

Launched at the beginning of 2020 with a portfolio tracker, we have now grown into a social network with over 300,000 members. We promote the exchange of ideas among friends, investors, and experts, helping our users manage their investments more effectively.

Supported by leading fintech investors such as Portage Ventures and Horizons Ventures, we are just getting started and have big plans ahead.

At getquin, we are more than just a company; we are a community. We are committed to the financial well-being of our users and embody innovation and collaboration.

We are looking for motivated individuals who share our mission and want to shape the future of investing.

Ready to make a difference in a dynamic, inclusive environment? Your journey begins here!

What You'll Be Doing


You will design and implement new APIs.
You will handle and optimize our existing backend services.
You get the possibility to build prototypes for future projects.
You are responsible for the optimisation of existing services in respect to availability and scalability.
You improve and monitor new and existing features.
You always stay up to date with state-of-the-art technologies.
We give you the chance to bring in your ideas and improvements to actively contribute to the company’s success.


What We Are Looking For


You have a deep knowledge of Python and FastAPI
You were able to gain experience with Postgres and Kafka.
You have knowledge of Docker.
You understand what is Continuous Delivery and TDD and use it in practice
You are able to work in the Agile startup environment
Good to have:
You were able to gain experience with TimescaleDB and Redis
You know how to deal with Kubernetes and GCP

Why join getquin?


Exciting Role: Work in a fast-growing B2C startup and help shape the future of investing.
Responsibility from Day One: Take on responsibility from your very first day and drive your projects independently.
Personal and Professional Growth: Experience a steep learning curve through close collaboration with your supervisor
Motivated Team: Work with a young, friendly, and highly motivated team.
Diverse Tasks: Look forward to exciting and varied tasks.
Quick Decision-Making: Benefit from open communication and short decision-making processes.


About Us

Become part of our mission and help shape the financial world of tomorrow with us! We look forward to meeting you and achieving great things together.

getquin is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We promote diversity and inclusion and prohibit any form of discrimination and harassment. With us, your talent matters, regardless of appearance, language, or beliefs.

Title: Data Scientist (w/m/d)
Description:
At HeyJobs, we have a clear mission: to help everyone find the right job and lead a fulfilling life. For 8 years, we've been revolutionizing the recruitment market with our AI-based job platform. Our technology simplifies the path to a new job like never before and helps companies solve their skilled labor shortages.

With over 4,700 satisfied clients, including 8 of the top 10 largest employers in Germany and Austria, leading companies rely on HeyJobs for their recruiting. Last year alone, we helped over 100,000 people find their new jobs. Already, more than 1% of all hires occur through the HeyJobs platform.

Our vision is to achieve the most hires in the market by 2030. To do this, we need you and your talents on our team. Become a part of HeyJobs and shape the future of recruiting with us! Join the HeyVolution!




We offer you an influential role in a fast-growing company:

As a Data Scientist (w/m/d) at HeyJobs, you will develop marketing steering models, which will help our Talent Marketing to attract talents to the job offers of our clients.

This role offers an exciting mix of developing data science models and running model performance analytics to fine-tune and calibrate our steering engine.




🎯 How you can contribute to HeyJobs

Design and development of marketing optimization models for our in-house marketing steering engine.
Active optimization and calibration of the marketing steering engine
Contribute full-stack, on the full lifecycle from conception to production
Run data exploration and experiments for feature discovery
Design metrics to track business outcomes and diagnostics for tracking model performance
Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, analysts and our marketing stakeholders
Work with languages and technologies like Python (pandas, scikit, PyTorch, Jupyter), Airflow, AWS (Redshift/Sagemaker), dbt, SQL




🤝 What sets you up for success

Academic degree (Masters or PhD) in an analytical field (e.g. statistics, mathematics, economics, logistics, data science, computer science, engineering or similar)
3-5 years of practical experience in conceptualizing and implementation of data science models.
Proficient in Python for Data Science and understanding the best-practices for data engineering (SQL, dbt, CI/CD, Git)
Having fun diving into problems with an unknown solution path
Good communication skills and ability to break down aspects of data science into stakeholder friendly explainers

Bonus Skills:

First experience using in MLOps
Background in Performance Marketing is helpful
Core understanding of data product management
Fluency in German




❤️‍🔥 What you will love about us

People & Values: We treat people in the way people should be treated, we bring out the best in everyone, we put our people first. Learn more here.
Work-Life Balance: 28 holidays*, plus 1 additional day p.a., 3 weeks work from anywhere per year and a 1-month paid sabbatical* every 3 years, flexible work hours
Growing individually and as a team: 7 step career framework, bi-yearly performance reviews, 3 days of yearly educational leave & 500€ budget*
Benefits: €50 monthly allowance* with Ben Card to spend on something you actually need and want. HeyJobs discounts for sustainable products and services via FutureBens & more
Societal Impact Employee Groups: Follow your passion with HeySustainability, HeyVoices, HeySisterhood, HeyPeace or found your own circle
Events & Feel Good initiatives: Fresh fruit, great drinks, monthly team lunch, 3 company-wide events per year, quarterly team events & plenty of feel good initiatives
Great offices with high quality equipment: MacBook / ThinkPad, screen for home office + additional hardware; HQ Berlin (Kreuzberg, Paul-Lincke-Ufer); HeyHub Cologne (Design Offices Gereon), HeyHub Vienna (centrally located in 1020 Vienna) all with standing desks, hybrid set-up meeting rooms & AC - good public transport connections & great lunch options.




At HeyJobs diversity and inclusion is key to creating a culture attracting the best talent and ultimately leading to achieving our vision. Together, we are 30 different nations, 45% women and 50% female leaders.

We are explicitly not hiring anyone who discriminates on the basis of religion, national origin, gender-identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or any other aspect that makes you. We encourage individuals from LGBTQIA+ and other underrepresented groups to apply.

We are proud to have been continuously ranked as one of Berlin's best tech employers!

See for yourself: Top Startup Employer (German), Kununu, Glassdoor, Top 25 LinkedIn Startups.

*offers may differ for international hubs and for employment status.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist - Natural Language Processing (NLP) (w/m/d) - hybrides Arbeiten (Remote & Präsenz)
Description:
Akkodis - entstanden durch den Zusammenschluss von AKKA & Modis - ist ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Engineering & IT. Als globaler Partner in einer sich ständig verändernden Technologie- & Wettbewerbsumgebung unterstützen wir unsere Kunden mit unserem 360°-Angebot dabei, eine nachhaltigere & smartere Zukunft zu gestalten. Vereint durch unsere gemeinsame Leidenschaft für Technologie & Talente betrachten wir die Welt aus einem neuen Blickwinkel. Unsere 50.000 motivierten Ingenieur:innen & Digitalexpert:innen gehen dabei täglich über das Mögliche hinaus, um Unglaubliches zu schaffen

Dann suchen wir Dich für ein Projekt unseres Kunden - ab sofort.

Deine Aufgaben



Du kannst bereits erste Berufserfahrung in der Analyse komplexer Daten aus unterschiedlichen Quellen mittels Natural Language Processing (NLP) Modellen, Computer Vision, Machine Learning vorweisen
Du wirkst an der Weiterentwicklung KI-basierter Lösungen zur automatisierten Erkennung, Interpretation und Verarbeitung von Audio-Video Materialien mit
Du erschließt neue Informationen und Zugänge zu bisher nicht nutzbaren Daten. Dazu evaluierst Du neue Technologien und entwickelst MVPs bis hin zum Einsatz ins Live-System
Du wirkst an der Weiterentwicklung KI-basierter Lösungen (Algorithmen)




Was Du dafür mitbringst



Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes (Fach-) Hochschulstudium im Bereich Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
Gute Erfahrung in Natural Language Processing angewandt auf nicht-wissenschaftliche Datensätze
Erfahrung mit manuellen und automatisiserten Methoden auf Textbausteine/-elemente (Algorithmen)
Erfahrung mit Pytorch, Tensorflow und/oder einem anderen gängigen DL-Framework
Erfahrung mit mindestens einem Python-API-Framework
Nice-to-have: Erfahrung im Umgang mit Machine Learning, AWS, Git und Docker
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse




Was Dich erwartet



Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm




Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.

Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung. Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Dein Kontakt Frau Michelle Boysen

karriere-berlin@akkodis.com

Akkodis Germany Tech Experts GmbH Information Technology

Lietzenburger Str. 51

10789 Berlin

Telefon +49 30 20398417

www.akkodis.com/de

  • Erfahrung mit Pytorch, Tensorflow und/oder einem anderen gängigen DL-Framework
  • Erfahrung mit mindestens einem Python-API-Framework
  • Nice-to-have: Erfahrung im Umgang mit Machine Learning, AWS, Git und Docker
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse



Was Dich erwartet


  • Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
  • Teamspirit und Diversität
  • Work-Life-Balance
  • Attraktive Vergütung
  • Sozialleistungen
  • Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
  • Team- und Sportevents
  • Globales Netzwerk
  • Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm



Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.

Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung. Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Lockers
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

The Vinted Go Points domain at Vinted Go is responsible for expanding and maintaining points (parcel lockers & shops that act as pick-up and drop-off points) network for our logistics operations. As a Decision Scientist, you will play a crucial role in optimising locker data usage for analytical purposes, gathering insights, and improving user flows by defining success metrics, conducting A/B tests, and creating insightful dashboards. Your responsibilities include ensuring a comprehensive view of locker performance, enhancing maintenance visibility, performing anomaly detection, and analysing recurring issues. This role also offers the opportunity to develop future capabilities for auto-detecting potential problems and upcoming maintenance needs to proactively address locker performance and user experience challenges.

We have three distinct roles within Data Science & Analytics (DSA). We believe each role can make a similar business impact in different ways, and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identifying algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed optimally, and designing, developing, and maintaining production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


In this position, you’ll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities, answer key business questions, improve, and maintain data products.
Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact.
Propose and implement key metrics that measure business performance, set up monitoring, and proactively flag issues.
Ensure requests are answered optimally (e.g., in the form of an ad hoc deep dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis).
Define the requirements for A/B testing and analyse the results of A/B tests.
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-service and dashboarding tools (Looker).
Closely collaborate with the product manager and help create a roadmap with prioritised hypotheses and analyses.


About You


Highly results-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes.
Strong communication skills, capable of presenting results to both technical and non-technical audiences convincingly.
Proficiency in dealing with technical challenges when building data products.
Entry to intermediate experience in the field of data analytics, typically 2+ years of work experience or equivalent proficiency.
Statistical proficiency, including A/B testing and regression analysis.
Fluent in SQL with practical experience in Python.
Experience with dashboarding tools such as Looker, Tableau, etc.
Advantageous: Experience collaborating with cross-functional product teams.
Advantageous: Background in logistics or e-commerce.


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,000 - € 77,100 gross per year.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist Bio Modelling (all Genders)
Description:
At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.

Machine Learning Scientist Bio Modelling (all Genders)

Develop innovative machine learning solutions to analyze biomedical datasets of different modalities with the goal of designing optimized molecules and improving our understanding of targets, diseases and patients.

Your Tasks And Responsibilities


Be an active member of a highly interdisciplinary and cross-organizational team
You will develop and evaluate state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms applied to modelling protein-ligand and protein-protein complexes
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams throughout R&D to ensure innovative algorithmic solutions are operationalized and integrated into our discovery pipelines
You will keep up to date with the latest advances in machine learning technologies
You will engage with the broader scientific community through publications, open-source projects, and conference presentations


Who You Are

We are excited about your talent and passion for this position. Attracting the right talent is important to us. We would be happy to work with you to identify and create the career and development opportunities you are looking for - also in parttime. And if you don't meet all the requirements, we still look forward to receiving your application. We are all constantly learning!

Required:


You have a highly scientific or engineering background, with a PhD degree or equivalent
You have expertise in machine learning research
You have a sincere interest for drug discovery and the life sciences
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Preferred:


You have expertise in bioinformatics or structural biology
You are an expert in applying machine learning for characterizing and designing small molecules, DNA/RNA, or proteins
You have expertise in applying, dissecting, and improving upon state-of-the-art machine learning methods. Knowledge of modern generative modelling methods (e.g., diffusion), protein language models (e.g., ESM), modern structure prediction methods (e.g., AlphaFold), or experience efficiently training and fine-tuning large models are a big plus
You have excellent software engineering skills
You have a strong publication record or demonstrated contributions (e.g., open source) for the above


What We Offer

Our benefits package is flexible, appreciative, and tailored to your lifestyle, because: What matters to you, matters to us!


We ensure your financial stability through a competitive compensation package, consisting of an attractive base pay and our annual bonus. In addition, managers can recognize special contributions by granting an individual performance award or top performance award.
Whether it’s hybrid work models or part-time arrangements: Whenever it is possible, you will have the flexibility to work how, when and where it is best for you.
Your family is a top priority. We offer loving company daycare centers at multiple locations, support in finding childcare, time off for the care of elderly or dependent family members, summer camps for children, and much more.
We support your professional growth by providing access to learning and development opportunities, training programs through the Bayer Learning Academy, development dialogues, as well as coaching and mentoring programs.
We promote health awareness and opportunities for selfcare through various measures, such as free health checks with the company doctor and our health platform #machfit.
We embrace diversity by providing an inclusive work environment in which you are welcomed, supported, and encouraged to bring your whole self to work.


The position is limited to two years.

Our target date to fill the position is 01.01.2025 (negotiable).

Be You. Be Bayer.

Location:

Germany : Berlin : Berlin || Germany : North Rhine Westfalia : Monheim

Division:

Pharmaceuticals

Reference Code:

822732

Title: Applied Scientist, Content Systems Science and Engineering, Amazon
Description:
Description

Do you get excited about working on scientific problems that will have a large, significant and lasting impact for Amazon customers? Are you interested in Computer Vision and Machine Learning? Are you thrilled about working in a startup-like environment alongside engineers, scientists and design technologists? Look no further! We have an opening for an Applied Scientist in Berlin.

As an Applied Scientist, you will be driving prototypes, projects and solutions in the fields of computer vision, machine learning and image optimisation. Our work sits right at the intersection of research and engineering and we are delivering products with real world impact for Amazon Retail Experiences.

Key job responsibilities


Research, design, implement and evaluate novel computer vision algorithms
Work on large-scale datasets, creating scalable, robust and accurate computer vision systems for various applications
Collaborate closely with other scientists and engineers to drive systems from prototyping to production level
Collaborate with teams across the world
Engage with the scientific community (within Amazon and beyond)
Think outside the box and identify novel opportunities for a better customer experience


Your work will impact the shopping experience for millions of Amazon customers every day. Your ideas allow a fast path to production at scale and help us reshape the way we think about images at Amazon.

A day in the life

Your day will be a mix of experimentation, coding and communication. You discuss your ideas and plans with your peers and other stakeholders, train and evaluate computer vision and machine learning models, and work on demos, prototypes and production code. You work closely with engineers and product managers to solve impactful business problems related to images at Amazon. You will be able to interact with the Amazon science community, for example through our internal machine learning conferences. Finally, you will have access to Amazon's extensive offerings for mentoring and training to keep learning and growing.

About The Team

The Content Systems Science and Engineering team develops foundational computer vision capabilities for the billions of images owned by Amazon. Our systems power technologies ranging from content moderation and product classification to marketing optimization and recommendation systems.

Basic Qualifications


PhD, or a Master's degree and experience in CS, CE, ML or related field
Experience in patents or publications at top-tier peer-reviewed conferences or journals
Experience programming in Java, C++, Python or related language
Experience developing and implementing deep learning algorithms, particularly with respect to computer vision algorithms


Preferred Qualifications


Experience using Unix/Linux
Experience in professional software development
Experience building machine learning models or developing algorithms for business application
Experience in any of the following areas: algorithms and data structures, parsing, numerical optimization, data mining, parallel and distributed computing, high-performance computing


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

m/w/d


Company - Amazon Development Center Germany GmbH

Job ID: A2670681

Title: Senior Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for senior engineers who are mindful of performance analysis and optimization to help us squeeze every last clock cycle out of Deep Learning training, inference and NVIDIA AI Services. We are working across all layers of the hardware/software stack, from GPU architecture to Deep Learning Framework, to achieve peak performance. This role offers an opportunity to directly impact the hardware and software roadmap in a fast-growing company that leads the AI revolution.

Join the team building software used by the entire world. Work with world class software engineers to implement blazingly fast SOTA deep learning models that help understanding the end-to-end performance of NVIDIA’s DL software and hardware stack. Work on most powerful, enterprise-grade GPU clusters capable of hundreds of Peta FLOPS and on unreleased hardware before anyone in the world. Are you ready for this challenge?

What You’ll Be Doing


Implement deep learning models from multiple data domains (CV, NLP/LLMs, ASR, TTS, RecSys and others) in multiple DL frameworks (PyT, JAX, TF2, DGL and others)
Implement and test new SW features (Graph Compilation, reduced precision training) that use the most recent HW functionalities.
Analyze, profile, and optimize deep learning workloads on state-of-the-art hardware and software platforms.
Collaborate with researchers and engineers across NVIDIA, providing guidance on improving the design, usability and performance of workloads.
Lead best-practices for building, testing, and releasing DL software


What We Need To See


3+ years of experience in DL model implementation and SW Development
BSc, MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Architecture or related technical field
Excellent Python programming skills, extensive knowledge of at least one DL Framework (PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX, MxNet)
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Algorithms and DL fundamentals


Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd


Experience in performance measurements and profiling
Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker
GPU programming experience (CUDA or OpenCL) is a plus but not required.
Solid understanding of Linux environments
Knowledge and love for DevOps/MLOps practices for Deep Learning-based product’s development.


NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and forward-thinking people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you! We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

#deeplearning

  • Excellent Python programming skills, extensive knowledge of at least one DL Framework (PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX, MxNet)
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills
  • Algorithms and DL fundamentals

Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd

  • Experience in performance measurements and profiling
  • Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker
  • GPU programming experience (CUDA or OpenCL) is a plus but not required.
  • Solid understanding of Linux environments
  • Knowledge and love for DevOps/MLOps practices for Deep Learning-based product’s development.

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most brilliant and forward-thinking people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you! We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

#deeplearning

Title: Senior ML Engineer
Description:
I am working with a company who are on a mission to connect doctors with patients through a specialty-specific cloud platform, thus improving patient experience!

Their vision is a world where the AI we design cures staff burnout, restores the joy of practicing medicine, and improves the patient experience!

The Innovation Center is seeking a Machine Learning Engineer for designing, implementing, and deploying scalable and robust machine learning solutions. This role will emphasize the development of production-ready algorithms and their integration into the company’s products or platforms.

Industry

OQ-industries MedTech

What To Expect


Design and Development: Engineer, fine-tune, and evaluate machine learning models for real-world, large-scale applications
Deployment: Deploy machine learning solutions into production using cloud platforms and containerization technologies.
Optimization: Identify performance problems and iterate on technical solutions.
Handle the entire ML lifecycle, including data collection, model training, versioning, monitoring, and retraining.
Tool Development: Design and develop tools and frameworks to improve the efficiency of the machine learning and data processing pipelines.


Perks


Flexible remote working policy
Unlimited holidays package
Personal education budget
Extensive career and growth opportunities in a fast-growing technology and health care area


Requirements

Requirements:


7+ years of experience in developing, deploying, and maintaining ML applications
A solid understanding of common ML algorithms, probability theory, and statistics e.g. Textual and Tabular data
Strong programming skills in Python, including best practices like CI/CD, Git, documenting
A good understanding of ML principles and algorithms (geared towards scalability, efficiency, and robustness), especially focused on NLP, and experience with frameworks like Pytorch or Tensorflow and Scikit-learn


Sounds good? Apply now


Show more

Title: Backend Engineer (Python)
Description:
Join Kini, an early-stage startup based in Berlin, dedicated to revolutionise recruiting based on data. Our integration platform empowers recruiting tools to exchange data effortlessly. Be part of our fast-growing team from the ground up, take ownership, and help build something truly innovative. The company is backed by well-known investors, partners already with big players in the market and is founded by an ambitous & complementary team.

Tasks

We are currently looking for a Backend Engineer to join us full-time as soon as possible. You will be one of our first hires and gonna play a key role in growing the company.

More specifically, you will do the following:


Take ownership: Build up our tech team, lead own projects and take personal responsibility.
Have impact: Build up our tech infrastructure and develop new products.
Python and Django Framework: Develop and maintain our web application using the Django framework and Python programming.
Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Integration: Collaborate with the team to design, implement, and integrate Google Cloud Platform services, including Cloud SQL, Cloud Storage, and Cloud Run.
Database Management: Manage and optimize database systems, applying knowledge of SQL to create and manage schemas efficiently.
RESTful APIs Development: Design, build, and maintain RESTful APIs, adhering to best practices in API development and integration.



Requirements

On a high-level, we are looking for entrepreneurial people that are at the top-of-their-game. In more specific terms, your skills should include:


Strong dedication and willingness to go the extra mile with us
Expertise in designing B2B Software applications
Strong problem-solving skills
Ideally 3+ years of software development experience
Proficiency or capacity to learn our tech stack: Python, Django, RESTful API, GCP
Previous founding / early-stage startup experience



Benefits

When you are joining our team you profit from:


Impact & Growth: At Qonexon you’ll get the possibility to shape a company from the earliest days and grow with us. We get things & decisions done in days instead of weeks.
Responsibility: From day one on, you’ll fully own your projects and get the chance to build up a team.
Freedom & Flexibility: We give you a lot of freedom and flexibility about how you do your work. Things just need to get done.
Salary: A competitive compensation based on meritocracy instead of politics.
Equity: We offer attractive equity packages to all our full-time employees.



How do we work?


Lean: We spend our resources wisely and efficient!
Ownership: We are a team of doers who take on responsibility and ownership proactively, work independently and get things done (well) with little oversight.
Excellence & Speed: We don’t want to be average. That’s why we strive for excellence and are obsessed with speed. We treat issues only with the complexity they deserve and do not overcomplicate/over-discuss things.
Teamwork: We win and lose as a team. Egoists are not accepted.
Fun: We don’t just work for the sake of working. Besides non-work related things we do as a team regularly (dinners, offsites, sports activities etc.), we want to have fun every day and don’t take things too seriously.
Hybrid: We don’t offer any fully remote positions (yet). We believe in the early days of a company working together in the same room and having team events regularly is extremely important. You can work from home, but we are looking for people who want to be part of and shape our company and culture not solely through video calls.



We are looking forward to hearing from you!
Show more

Title: (Senior) AI Scientist (f/m/d) for the SAP BTP Innovation Team
Description:
We help the world run better

At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

What You'll Do

At SAP, we are bringing together state-of-the-art AI technology with our extensive industry-specific data and deep process knowledge to create innovative AI capabilities across SAP products & services. Large Language Models (LLMs) hold immense potential to change the way we work and develop products. They are reshaping the landscape of Machine Learning across various domains. However, they are not the final stage of AI advancements and there is a lot of untapped potential to use data other than language to solve modern problems of business software. It is SAP's mission to overcome these challenges within the realm of Business AI.

As (Senior) AI Scientist, You Will


Develop innovative, scalable and high performing technical solutions by applying state-of-the-art technologies to SAP and customer problems.
Continuously research, implement and document emerging trends in AI/ML and evaluate their potential in an SAP context
Be a thought leader on how to best use SAPs knowledge and data together with latest AI advancements to gain a competitive advantage
The usual data science tasks such as data extraction, data cleaning, data exploration, feature engineering, and model building, with a focus on developing robust pipelines.
Drive AI workloads from idea to handover for production by defining and running experiments and integrating results into prototypes
Advance the data science and machine learning practices of our team to build better models faster.
Work closely with product management, designers, developers, and other data scientists to ensure project success


What You Bring


PhD or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or other relevant disciplines
Deep understanding of the latest advancements in AI such as Transformer (and all its offsprings), Large Language Models, Large Multimodal Models, fine-tuning, RAG, Agents, etc.
Proficiency in Python, and experience with Data Science frameworks such as PyTorch, transformers, pandas, spark, etc.
Experience with cloud software development tools: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub, AWS, BTP
Proven history of exemplary leadership and strategic mindset, complemented by superior organizational abilities.
Contributions to open-source projects or relevant private projects that demonstrate AI/ML skills are a plus
Start-up experience or background is a plus.


Meet The Team

The mission of the SAP BTP Innovation Team is to contextualize and pioneer emerging technologies that will be foundational for the future success of SAP BTP and of our customers. We are a diverse, global team and collaborate across roles, functions, and locations, enabling every colleague to contribute and investigate new ideas.

Our team in Potsdam explores new ways of working with technology to free up people’s creativity and ingenuity by reducing their repetitive tasks, brining contextual information at the right place and at the right time, and enabling time for the high value activities that have a real business impact. We work on articulating and prototyping visions of enterprise software beyond the current roadmaps, investigating the most important jobs-to-be-done in the enterprise, and run projects to take us closer to fully autonomous enterprise software. You can watch our vision behind the future of finance here. We currently drive a portfolio of projects that leverage state of the art AI and research and adapt it to be the best business AI in the world.

Bring out your best

SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.

We win with inclusion

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

Requisition ID: 402707 | Work Area: Software-Design und Entwicklung | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Berufserfahren | Employment Type: Part-Time, or Regular Full-Time

Title: AI Solutions Engineer
Description:
Overview:

As an AI Solutions Engineer at Aleph Alpha GmbH, you will play a critical role in leveraging Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies to develop innovative solutions that address complex business challenges. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including, software engineers, and product managers, to design, implement, and optimize AI-driven systems for our clients. This position offers an exciting opportunity to apply cutting-edge AI techniques and make a significant impact across various industries.







Your responsibilities:

Prompt and finetune large language models
Facilitating customer evaluations and PoC
Collaborate with Engineering and Product to help them shape a stable production environment
Develop and manage a detailed customer project schedule
Communicate innovative solutions to our customers and external partners
Understand customer requirements and translate them into project objectives
Stay on top of the latest AI developments to shape our vision at the intersection of market needs and innovation




Your profile:

You have experience with complex projects and managing their entire life cycle
You have fundamental knowledge of ML, and basic knowledge of AI and Large Language Models
Intermediate Skills in Python
Good understanding of IT Applications and Architecture
Fundamental/Advanced Understanding of Machine Learning and AI
2+ years working on customer-facing technical pre/post-sales projects to enable customer success
You have a solution-oriented mindset that helps you to solve problems creatively
You can identify and implement high-impact processes in unstructured environments
You have excellent communication skills in English and German




Nice to have:

You have experience working in a fast-paced start-up environment




What you can expect from us:

Become part of an AI revolution
30 Days of paid vacation
Flexible working hours
Join a dynamic start-up and a rapidly growing team
Work with international industry and science experts
Take on responsibility and shape our company and technology
Regular team events
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Operations Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Ihre Mission


Sie arbeiten mit Ihren Kollegen aus Machine Learning (ML), Data und Entwicklung zusammen, um Modelle im medizinischen Bereich zu operationalisieren und in das Produktivsystem zu überführen
Sie entwerfen und pflegen die für ML erforderliche Infrastruktur
Sie implementieren skalierbare Lösungen für die Modellverfolgung und -bereitstellung
Sie gewährleisten die Skalierbarkeit und Sicherheit der ML-Infrastruktur
Sie identifizieren und beheben Probleme und optimieren Modelle zur Effizienzsteigerung



Ihre Talente


Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik mit Fokus ML oder vergleichbare Ausbildung
Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung, Bereitstellung und Wartung von Infrastrukturen für den Lebenszyklus von maschinellem Lernen
Gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python und Vertrautheit mit relevanten ML-Frameworks
Erfahrung mit Container-Technologien (Docker, Kubernetes) und Cloud-Plattformen (AWS, GCP oder Azure)
Vertrautheit mit dem Konzept Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) mit praktischen Kenntnissen von Terraform oder Ansible
Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse



Ihre Benefits


Flexible Arbeitszeiten & mobiles Arbeiten: In vielen Bereichen lassen sich Arbeitszeit und -ort nach Bedarf gestalten
30 Urlaubstage sowie diverse Sonderzahlungen
Weiterbildungsangebote: Offenes Inhouse-Seminarprogramm, umfangreiches E-Learning-Angebot, fachliche Weiterbildungen u.v.m.
Corporate Benefits-Vorteilsangebote und Fahrrad-Leasing
Zuschuss zur privaten Altersvorsorge und betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement
Verschiedene Kinderbetreuungsangebote – am Hauptsitz in Tuttlingen
Gesundheits-, Sport-, Kultur- und Freizeitangebote – Angebote unterscheiden sich je nach Standort

Show more

Title: (Junior) React Developer (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir suchen Dich als React Developer!

Wir suchen einen engagierten und motivierten (Junior) React Developer (m/w/d), der gern innovative, effektive und skalierbare Lösungen entwickelt und Spaß daran hat, je nach Bedarf im Projektgeschäft oder an der Weiterentwicklung unseres CXM Systems Universal Messenger mitzuarbeiten.

Komm in unser Team und werde Experte für ein spezielles Themenfeld, das wir gemeinsam anhand Deiner Interessen und Fähigkeiten identifizieren.

Was Dich bei uns erwartet

Modernste Technik

Wir setzen eine Vielzahl an Technologien und Frameworks ein und sind immer neugierig und offen für Neues. In den meisten Projekten hat sich derzeit React als Frontend-Basis etabliert.

Der Nutzer im Mittelpunkt unserer Technologie

Unser Enterprise Software Universal Messenger steht für ganzheitlichen personalisierten Kundendialog – von E-Mail-Marketing über Realtime Targeting bis Customer Experience Management.

Deine Ideen sind die Realität von morgen

Bei uns bist du von Anfang an dabei - Mitarbeit in allen Projektphasen sowie Beratung von internen Projektteams und Kunden, um das perfekte Nutzererlebnis zu realisieren.

Bei uns als Entwickler arbeiten


Wir sind eine Familie, immer offen für Neues und mit Spaß an der gemeinsamen Arbeit.
Einchecken - In Berlin erwartet dich ein attraktives Büro in toller Lage in der Nähe vom Checkpoint Charlie, mit zwei Balkonen und ausreichend Platz zum Arbeiten und Durchatmen - kein Großraumchaos.
Möglichkeit zur vollständigen Remote Arbeit
Sorgsame Einarbeitung durch einen Kollegen, Teamarbeit und Fehlertoleranz
Vielfältige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Attraktives und marktgerechtes Gehalt
Get-the-job-done-Mentalität - Flexible Arbeitszeiten, denn bei uns muss man nicht sitzen bleiben, bis der Chef nach Hause geht
IT-Umgebung nach Deinem Wunsch - PC oder Laptop, Windows, Mac oder Linux – das bleibt Dir überlassen.
Reizvolle Mitarbeiterrabatte und Team-Events
Cheers - Kostenlose Getränke wie Wasser, Kaffee, Tee, Club Mate und Cola, sowie Obst in unserer Kaffeeküche


Neue Herausforderungen warten auf Dich

Du brennst für moderne Web-Entwicklung und Individuallösungen und hast Lust in verschiedenen Bereichen (z.B. technische Konzeption, Webentwicklung und DevOps) zu arbeiten? Du suchst eine Arbeit, bei der Du Deine Stärken einbringen und Dich dynamisch entwickeln kannst?

Dann haben wir genau die richtige Herausforderung für Dich!


Du hast Spaß an der Entwicklung und Pflege von effizienten, zuverlässigen und wiederverwendbaren Web-Applikationen und Apps u.a. für unser Produkt Universal Messenger
Mit deinem Anspruch an Qualität optimierst du unsere Lösungen für maximale Stabilität und Skalierbarkeit
Code Reviews sind für Dich Alltag zur Sicherstellung sehr hoher Qualitätsansprüche
Designs und Konzepte übersetzt Du in eine technische Implementierung und entwickelst robuste Lösungen mit hoher UX
Weitergabe von Wissen an Deine Teammitglieder zum Ausbau von Expertise
Je nach Erfahrung hast du die Wahl zwischen Ausgestaltung der Entwicklungsstrategie, Projekt- und/oder Teamverantwortung


Was Du mitbringst


Gute JavaScript / React Kenntnisse sowie Erfahrung mit HTML5, CSS3
Erfahrungen mit Technologien wie SASS, Grunt, Gulp oder NodeJS
Vertrautheit mit GitLab oder GitHub
Erste Erfahrungen mit Mobile Development, Responsive Design und Barrierefreiheit
Ausgeprägtes Verständnis für User Interface Design und User Experience
Vertrautheit mit dem gesamten Entwicklungszyklus von der Anforderungsbestimmung bis hin zur Dokumentation
Verständnis von geläufigen Build- und CI Systemen
Gute Deutschkenntnisse und idealerweise gutes Englisch
Show more
HTML:
Wir suchen Dich als React Developer!

Wir suchen einen engagierten und motivierten (Junior) React Developer (m/w/d), der gern innovative, effektive und skalierbare Lösungen entwickelt und Spaß daran hat, je nach Bedarf im Projektgeschäft oder an der Weiterentwicklung unseres CXM Systems Universal Messenger mitzuarbeiten.

Komm in unser Team und werde Experte für ein spezielles Themenfeld, das wir gemeinsam anhand Deiner Interessen und Fähigkeiten identifizieren.

Was Dich bei uns erwartet

Modernste Technik

Wir setzen eine Vielzahl an Technologien und Frameworks ein und sind immer neugierig und offen für Neues. In den meisten Projekten hat sich derzeit React als Frontend-Basis etabliert.

Der Nutzer im Mittelpunkt unserer Technologie

Unser Enterprise Software Universal Messenger steht für ganzheitlichen personalisierten Kundendialog – von E-Mail-Marketing über Realtime Targeting bis Customer Experience Management.

Deine Ideen sind die Realität von morgen

Bei uns bist du von Anfang an dabei - Mitarbeit in allen Projektphasen sowie Beratung von internen Projektteams und Kunden, um das perfekte Nutzererlebnis zu realisieren.

Bei uns als Entwickler arbeiten

  • Wir sind eine Familie, immer offen für Neues und mit Spaß an der gemeinsamen Arbeit.
  • Einchecken - In Berlin erwartet dich ein attraktives Büro in toller Lage in der Nähe vom Checkpoint Charlie, mit zwei Balkonen und ausreichend Platz zum Arbeiten und Durchatmen - kein Großraumchaos.
  • Möglichkeit zur vollständigen Remote Arbeit
  • Sorgsame Einarbeitung durch einen Kollegen, Teamarbeit und Fehlertoleranz
  • Vielfältige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
  • Attraktives und marktgerechtes Gehalt
  • Get-the-job-done-Mentalität - Flexible Arbeitszeiten, denn bei uns muss man nicht sitzen bleiben, bis der Chef nach Hause geht
  • IT-Umgebung nach Deinem Wunsch - PC oder Laptop, Windows, Mac oder Linux – das bleibt Dir überlassen.
  • Reizvolle Mitarbeiterrabatte und Team-Events
  • Cheers - Kostenlose Getränke wie Wasser, Kaffee, Tee, Club Mate und Cola, sowie Obst in unserer Kaffeeküche

Neue Herausforderungen warten auf Dich

Du brennst für moderne Web-Entwicklung und Individuallösungen und hast Lust in verschiedenen Bereichen (z.B. technische Konzeption, Webentwicklung und DevOps) zu arbeiten? Du suchst eine Arbeit, bei der Du Deine Stärken einbringen und Dich dynamisch entwickeln kannst?

  • Designs und Konzepte übersetzt Du in eine technische Implementierung und entwickelst robuste Lösungen mit hoher UX
  • Weitergabe von Wissen an Deine Teammitglieder zum Ausbau von Expertise
  • Je nach Erfahrung hast du die Wahl zwischen Ausgestaltung der Entwicklungsstrategie, Projekt- und/oder Teamverantwortung

Was Du mitbringst

  • Gute JavaScript / React Kenntnisse sowie Erfahrung mit HTML5, CSS3
  • Erfahrungen mit Technologien wie SASS, Grunt, Gulp oder NodeJS
  • Vertrautheit mit GitLab oder GitHub
  • Erste Erfahrungen mit Mobile Development, Responsive Design und Barrierefreiheit
  • Ausgeprägtes Verständnis für User Interface Design und User Experience
  • Vertrautheit mit dem gesamten Entwicklungszyklus von der Anforderungsbestimmung bis hin zur Dokumentation
