Title: Automation Developer
Description:
Day to Day Responsibilities:

Backlog on Jira
Working on tickets
Coding on the existing frameworks
Any redundant repetitive tasks - need to find an innovative solution though programming
Enhancing existing framework, adding features
Framework based on Java, Selenium, BDD Cucumber
Hands on coding - Springboot, Multithreading, building APIS, MongoDB **
NOT TESTING, just developing
Prior experience with automation projects




Must-Have:

Java (8-10 years)
Fullstack Developer with MongoDB (Can consider Oracle)
Springboot (front end)
Automation project - Using Selenium to build automation solution (Building a framework)
Hands on coding - Springboot, Multithreading, building APIS, MongoDB
Working on Test Automation SOLUTIONS - building innovation, building utility




Nice to have:

Banking
Working on Test Automation SOLUTIONS - building innovation, building utility.
AI and Machine Learning projects.

Title: Software Engineer - Simulation
Description:
Who are we?

Oxa is enabling the transition to self-driving vehicles through an initial focus on the most commercially advanced sector; the autonomous shuttling of goods and people.

We are home to some of the world's leading experts on autonomous vehicles, creating solutions such as Oxa Driver, equipping vehicles with full self-driving functionality; Oxa MetaDriver, using Generative AI to accelerate and assure the safety of deployments; and Oxa Hub, a set of cloud-based offerings for autonomous fleet management. Our technology is being deployed across the UK and the U.S, and we're partnering with a fast-growing ecosystem of operators, vehicle OEMs and equipment makers serving autonomous transportation globally as it advances.

Based in Oxford, and with offices in Canada and the U.S, Oxa was founded in 2014 and is  growing rapidly (350+ ‘Oxbots' to date). Our purpose is to change the way the Earth moves, through an uncompromising focus on safety, efficiency and explainability of our AI approaches. The company has attracted $225 million from leading investors so far, with $140 million raised in the last Series C funding round in January 2023.

Your Team

MetaDriver is a suite of tools that combines generative AI, digital twins and simulation to accelerate machine learning and testing of self-driving technology before and during real-world use. You will join our Oxa MetaDriver Team which is responsible for delivering these technologies to both internal and external customers. It comprises a wide range of disciplines from ML and simulation, to application development, cloud engineering and data capture professionals.

Specifically, you'll be working in the scenario expansion workstream.

Your Role

As part of the MetaDriver Scenario Expansion team, you will be contributing to the development of state-of-the-art scenario synthesis tools and frameworks, ensuring the generation of effective and diverse driving scenarios for validating and improving autonomous vehicles
Adapt and customise our in-house Oxa Simulator as well as open source driving simulators (e.g. CARLA) to suit our scenario generation & autonomous driving stack requirements, ensuring seamless integration and compatibility
Develop frameworks and interfaces for large scale traffic simulation
Contribute to the development tools and processes which will support the acquisition of data, scenario generation, and ML frameworks in software-in-the-loop simulation
Collaborate closely with our advanced scenario generation and simulation teams to align simulation efforts with scenario tools and processes
Analyse and identify potential improvements in simulation accuracy, fidelity, and performance to optimise system development
Propose and architect systems for enabling the use of real-world driving scenarios in simulation
Working closely with our Scenario Expansion team as well as other teams and leads in facilitating the integration of scenario generation and replay tools with driving simulators, creation of specialist tooling and processes, and supporting the use of MetaDriver across the company



Requirements



What you need to succeed{{:}}

Experience on developing applications using game engines like Unity or Unreal 4
Proven experience working with CARLA or other similar driving simulators, showing understanding of its architecture and features
Ability to define and develop effective interfaces for simulators
Software development skills in Python and C++
Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

Extra kudos{{:}}

Experience on integrating simulation with machine learning tools and frameworks
Hands-on experience converting real world locations to CARLA maps and/or real driving scenarios to simulated scenarios
Familiarity with cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Knowledge of OpenScenario/OpenDrive formats
Solid experience developing with continuous integration and testing systems

The Candidate Journey{{:}} Multi-Step and Two-Way

No-one wants to feel like a square peg in a round hole, so this process is designed to give you every chance to get the measure of us, and us of you. The various stages give you every opportunity to show your unique strengths and qualities, and enables each of us to establish if we're a good fit for the other. If the fit is good and you're selected, you're then in a position to do great work and thrive, which is what everyone wants.



Benefits



Compensation and Benefits

We provide{{:}}

Competitive salary, benchmarked against the market and reviewed annually
Hybrid working arrangements
Life Insurance
AD&D Insurance
Long Term Disability Insurance
Critical Illness Cover
Extended Health Care
Dental Cover
Health Spending Account
Personal Spending Account
Employee Assistance Program

Our Culture

Diversity is a marathon not a sprint! It is a journey with no destination. We are on a mission to unlock the benefits of self-driving technology to every person and organisation on the planet. We are creating an environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work which put simply is the right thing to do. We hire and nurture those we can learn from, valuing diversity and the innovation that this drives.

We apply a neuro inclusive lens to our recruitment process and want each potential Oxbot to enjoy the best experience possible for them. We promote an open and inclusive culture that empowers our Oxbots to bring their whole, authentic selves to work every day. Oxa is proud to be an inclusive organisation and, as such, we require all team members within our recruitment process to understand and deploy best practices focused on de-biasing the whole recruitment cycle.

Please share with us any individual needs or reasonable adjustments we may need to make in advance of commencing the interview process with us.

Learn more about our culture here.[Link to careers page.]

Why become an Oxbot?

Our team of experts in computer science, AI, robotics and machine learning is world-class, and together they're solving the most exciting and important technological challenges of our times.

But as well as smarts, Oxbots have heart. Our diverse, multi-cultural crew is guided by a shared vision to bring the myriad benefits of autonomy to our customers and partners. And in a company that celebrates uniqueness as much as skill and experience, they do it with energy, conviction and a healthy dose of excitement, too.

If you are bold, creative and hyper skilled, come and create the future of autonomy with us at Oxa.

Show more
